intro: Habenella zambesina, commonly known as the Zambesian flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, which bloom in late summer. It is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its resilience and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
